Means gathering together by tossing. Also kə-aɨ, tearing off to gather; tɨrɨ-aɨ, gather with the fingernails; ãihi-ãi, collect by twisting off.

hamɨ is locative; see following prepositions; also 'where' 17.660.

Has meaning of going and coming—passing a limit/ edge in either direction.
Respectively: various locations. Also titətə-; ahete-.
Respectively: various locations. Also titətə-; ahete-.
Respectively: smoke black; urucú; genipa. Also kašipɨnayoma 'tinta morada que se saca de una hoja'; and [pintura], from Spanish.

Also wɨɨ, a different type of basket.
Respectively: to pierce one time; to pierce various times (+ sandhi).
Respectively: to pierce one time; to pierce various times (+ sandhi).
Means to rub with something. Also hɨrɨkɨ-aɨ, r. with the hand; hõrere-ãɨ, r. with a vine.
Means to t. in two; also kaka-aɨ, t. a piece off; kaka-maɨ, t. in pieces.

Means to break with the hand. Also huheti-aɨ, b. a thread or something long; šə-praɨ, b. something round; yahatʰo-praɨ, b. a round object, hitting with a stick; yaheki-praɨ, b. a long object, hitting with a stick.

Various forms, depending on how an object is cut and the shape of the object. Respectively: cut with a knife; cut a round object; cut along the long axis; cut lengthwise. Also pəyə, cut by beating; paheti-, cut a large object by beating from above; tiheti-, cut in pieces.

Various forms, depending on how an object is cut and the shape of the object. Respectively: cut with a knife; cut a round object; cut along the long axis; cut lengthwise. Also pəyə, cut by beating; paheti-, cut a large object by beating from above; tiheti-, cut in pieces.

Various forms, depending on how an object is cut and the shape of the object. Respectively: cut with a knife; cut a round object; cut along the long axis; cut lengthwise. Also pəyə, cut by beating; paheti-, cut a large object by beating from above; tiheti-, cut in pieces.

Various forms, depending on how an object is cut and the shape of the object. Respectively: cut with a knife; cut a round object; cut along the long axis; cut lengthwise. Also pəyə, cut by beating; paheti-, cut a large object by beating from above; tiheti-, cut in pieces.
Refers to the state of being in a knot.
Various kinds: hediondo; comestible; comestible, etc.

Means manioc root, which is the edible part; naši sikɨ is the plant; naši hĩkɨ̃ is the prepared food.

Means blowing the seeds out of the hand. Also šəyə-haɨ.
Central plaza in the collective housing.
Feathers and animal skins for adornment.
Means to press with the fingers; hutiki-praɨ, between the fingers; hɨkɨ-praɨ, between the fingernails; katiki-aɨ, crush with the foot; and other forms.
Respectively: in water; over the coals/embers.
Respectively: in water; over the coals/embers.
Lit. 'red' 15.660; 'blue' 15.670, depending upon the natural color of the fruit when it is ripe.

Means to become sick; hariri means to be sick.
The YNM do not bury their dead. This entry is an accomodation to western customs. Also means 'dig; plant' 08.220; 08.531.
The latter is shaking from a fever.
The latter is shaking from a fever.
Respectively: 'dream; talking in sleep; dream of distant persons or places'.

suhe pə is 'milk' 05.860; u- classifier (liquid); ka classifier (hollow).
Refers to upper lip; kasi-kɨ is the lower lip. Cf. 'edge' 12.353.
Respectively: 'my body; your body'; final morpheme is a personal pronoun.
Respectively: 'my body; your body'; final morpheme is a personal pronoun.
A night variety is wari mahe.
A night variety is wari mahe.
Refers to any bird of prey.
Wild or game bird. Also kiritʰamɨ; piõmɨ, small birds.
Consanguineous, of the same generation and same sex.
This form and the following in-law terms are all possessed, 1st person.
Lit. 'my elder', fem., vocative form. Cf. 'older sister' 02.454.
Lit. 'my elder', masc., vocative form. Cf. 'older brother' 02.444.
Possessed form of 'brother', man speaking, or 'sister', woman speaking.
Possessed form of 'brother', man speaking, or 'sister', woman speaking.
Lit. 'to throw out, get rid of' 10.250.
Also ya-praɨ, to throw on the fire.
Also õmãyãri a no mayõ, lit. the path of 'õmãyãri', the supernatural.
Means 'wind' 01.720. Also hekura pə huu, when it is very windy, lit. the spirits are displeased.
Respectively: 'large river; small river'. Cf. poko 'arm' 04.310.
Respectively: 'large river; small river'. Cf. poko 'arm' 04.310.
Lit. where the water is divided.
he is a morpheme with the meaning of 'limit', or more precisely, 'upper limit; cf. 'head' 04.200.
Used with aspect marker. Cf. 'last, endure' 14.252.
Lit. 'able-negative'. It is used to modify the sense of another verb, e.g., a hu-u ta-o-mi 'never comes'.
Inchoative form, with meaning of being in process.
Respectively: with the hand, and with the foot.
Respectively: with the hand, and with the foot.
Means to call out; also rãã-mou, to cry out in pain; miyõ-miyõ-mou, cry out in fear.
Means to call someone by shouting. Also naka-ɨ; and husi he-ãmou to call someone by whistling.
Means 'leader, elder' 14.150. Actually, a 'chief, jefe' does not exist among the YNM, but the elder is recognized.
Used with intransitive verb. Also nosiye-maɨ, with transitive verb.
Means f. with bow and arrow. Also šə-you, f. with a stick.
